column1: 4CC4E864-4CCE-4D05-B4B3-C1B6F28F0408#appfire#F0B611D6-F64E-4F33-B720-823F3C5E95A9#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-29 08:36:58.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-29 08:36:58.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#7D8E1ABF-C1C3-4B52-9C21-E3CF2A0BB457#appfire#F0B611D6-F64E-4F33-B720-823F3C5E95A9#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-29 08:36:58.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-29 08:36:58.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#D8FC14CF-5B37-44A3-8202-0407C7014CA8#appfire#F0B611D6-F64E-4F33-B720-823F3C5E95A9#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-29 08:36:58.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-03-29 08:36:58.0#appfire#1
